results.title: Irma La Douce
results.creator_credit: Orry-Kelly, Daniel Mandell, Billy Wilder, Edward Alperson and Mirisch Corporation
results.brief_description: Comedy set in the red-light district of Paris, where Irma La Douce (Shirley MacLaine) is a “working girl”. A naive gendarme (Jack Lemmon) falls for the beautiful Irma after conducting a one-man raid on a notorious backstreet establishment. He becomes Irma’s “business manager” but soon becomes insanely jealous of her clientele and in despair, devises a clever way to keep her all to himself. MacLaine and Lemmon display their impressive comic talents under Billy Wilder’s direction. This screen adaptation was based on the successful Broadway musical.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Orry-Kelly, Daniel Mandell, Billy Wilder, Edward Alperson and Mirisch Corporation

results.title: Spartacus
results.creator_credit: Robert Lawrence, Stanley Kubrick, Edward Lewis, Bryna Productions and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Spartacus is a rousing testament to the spirit and dignity of man, dealing with a revolt by slaves against the pagan Roman Empire, based on the novel by Howard Fast.

constellations_other.name: Swords, sandals and lightning bolts
constellations_other.description: In Thor: Love and Thunder, Russell Crowe plays one of the most recogniseable gods in the pantheon – Zeus. His scenes lampoon his Oscar-winning role in Gladiator, one of the most recognised films in a classic genre.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Lawrence, Stanley Kubrick, Edward Lewis, Bryna Productions and Universal Pictures
results.description: Spartacus is a rousing testament to the spirit and dignity of man, dealing with a revolt by slaves against the pagan Roman Empire, based on the novel by Howard Fast. As a spectacle, the clash between the slave army led by Kirk Douglas, and the Romans commanded by Laurence Olivier, is nothing short of amazing. Douglas is the mainstay of the picture. He is not particularly expressive, in contrast to the sophisticated Olivier, the conniving parasite gladiator ring operator portrayed by Peter Ustinov or the supple and subtle slave maiden played by Jean Simmons. However, Douglas succeeds admirably in giving an impression of a man who is afire within. Some 8,000 Spanish soldiers became Roman legionaires for the massive battle sequences filmed outside Madrid, but the rest of the picture was made in Hollywood. Cast also includes Charles Laughton. Based on novel by Howard Fast.
description_for_label: Spartacus is a rousing testament to the spirit and dignity of man, dealing with a revolt by slaves against the pagan Roman Empire, based on the novel by Howard Fast. However, Douglas succeeds admirably in giving an impression of a man who is afire within. Some 8,000 Spanish soldiers became Roman legionaires for the massive battle sequences filmed outside Madrid, but the rest of the picture was made in Hollywood. Cast also includes Charles Laughton. results.title: The More things change
results.creator_credit: Jill Bilcock, Robyn Nevin, Jill Robb, New South Wales Film Corporation and Syme International Productions
results.brief_description: A couple decide to give up living in the city and move to a farm, where the husband takes over the job of looking after their young son whilst his wife continues her city job. To alleviate the tension arising from the change in roles they hire a 19 year old live-in child minder who is also four months pregnant. Stars Judy Morris, Barry Otto and Victoria Longley.

results.title: The Chant of Jimmie Blacksmith
results.creator_credit: Brian Kavanagh, Fred Schepisi and The Film House
results.brief_description: Based on the Thomas Keneally novel, this is the fictionalised story of Jimmy Governor, who, in 1901 went on a rampage killing numerous white settlers. Deft characterisation and ironic detail combine to paint a bleak portrait of a bitterly racist society emerging as a federated nation. Starring Tommy Lewis in the title role with co-stars Ray Barrett and Jack Thompson.

constellations_other.name: Fred Schepisi
constellations_other.description: Fred Schepisi's diverse body of work connects to acclaimed local productions, westerns and Hollywood favourites.

results.title: Kakadu: land of the crocodile (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: David Greig, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
Val Plumwood, environmental philosopher returns to Kakadu, where she was the victim of a crocodile attack. Against the backdrop of the steamy, intensely beautiful Kakadu National Park, viewers share her thoughts on wilderness and wildlife.

results.title: The Australian Alps: Mirka's Palace of Dreams (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Bill Murphy, David Greig, David Morgan and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
This program is the last in a series of six documentaries that examine the wilderness areas of Australia. Mirka Mora is an eccentric artist, French by birth, who had never before ventured into the wilderness nor slept in a tent. Along with Tim McCartney Snape, the first Australian ever to reach the summit of Mt. Everest, and a Nepalese Sherpa, she travels into the Kosciusko wilderness. Mirka’s unique and expressive personality helps viewers see and experience this wilderness from an artist’s perspective.
results.title_for_label: The Australian Alps: Mirka’s Palace of Dreams (Captioned)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Murphy, David Greig, David Morgan and Kestrel Film Productions

results.title: My Urban Garden
results.creator_credit: Les Halman, Polly Bennell and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A practical guide with some “helpful hints” on how to plan your own urban vegetable garden. This will appeal to all gardening enthusiasts and possibly even inspire those who have never tried.

results.title: The Desert hopping mouse
results.creator_credit: David Corke and Educational Media International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Web of life”.
Focuses on the spinifex hopping mouse of inland Australia to illustrate the many features it possesses which enable it to survive in what appears to be an extremely hostile environment. Also shows its daily activities, its methods of reproduction and the ways in which these may change with the seasons or from year to year. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: In your hands: hygiene in the food industry
results.creator_credit: Catherine Murphy, Rodney Land and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Highlights aspects of food handling which are the personal responsibility of the food handler. Discusses the sources of potentially hazardous bacteria and the various means by which these bacteria may be transferred to food.

results.title: Dean and Donna
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, Martyn Down, Sandra Richardson, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “I myself”.
Part of a series designed to facilitate discussion of various issues and themes related to social education, human relations and personal development and designed for use with primary-school and lower secondary school children in the 8 to 14 year age range. This part looks at Donna and Dean who are learning to adjust to different ‘blended family’ situations. Donna and her natural brother Scott have joined older brothers and sisters. Donna is now no longer the eldest. Dean lives with his father and new step-mother. They have recently had a baby. Explores the feelings they express while they are seeking to make the necessary readjustments.
